TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 917
TEI.2.document_title: James Dill to Stephen F. Austin, 10-07-1824

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 917

div1.p: Dear Sir I want you if you please to take the deposition of Mr John Irons respecting A certain horse which he traded to Lacoast for a cart while he was in this section of Country as the horse has been claimed by Sepulver which has caused a great deal of Cavling and Law suites as I want Mr Irons to state when he got the horse and whare and of Who so that I may defend the rights of Mr Irons properly in his absence and if he dose not give satisfactory statement so that the thing can be done a way he will have the horse to pay for I am yours respectfully
